intro: Leptorkis barbata, commonly known as the barbed lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically yellowish to greenish in color, and features distinct, barbed lobes that give it its common name. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a photosynthetic partner, usually a green alga or cyanobacterium. It thrives in shaded, humid environments, often found on tree bark or rocks in temperate regions. Due to its slow growth and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a relatively rare and sensitive indicator of environmental conditions.
